text: Does anyone know why this repo's CompatHelper doesn't start CI? <https://github.com/SciML/DiffEqBayes.jl/pull/200>

elements.text: Does anyone know why this repo's CompatHelper doesn't start CI?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/55061| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
the issue is that by default workflows can't trigger other workflows, so CompatHelper can't trigger CI.  the workaround is to use an SSH key (for example DocumenterKey)

elements.text: the issue is that by default workflows can't trigger other workflows, so CompatHelper can't trigger CI.  the workaround is to use an SSH key (for example DocumenterKey)

text: One workaround is to close and response that pr manually

elements.text: One workaround is to close and response that pr manually
